text: Dab is a village and Union Council, an administrative subdivision, of Chakwal District in the Punjab Province of Pakistan. It is part of Chakwal Tehsil and is located at 33° 0' 0" N 72° 52' 0" E. The village is the birthplace of the Victoria Cross winner Khudadad Khan and is also known to have given a high number of volunteers to the British Indian Army and the British war effort during the First World War.Location of Dhab – Falling Rain Genomics ==References== Category:Union councils of Chakwal District
title: Dab, Chakwal
